title: The 4 best iPad models of 2022
description: There are plenty of iPad to choose from -- from the powerhouse of the iPad Pro to the portability of the iPad Air. There's truly an iPad for everyone, including you. To help you decide which to get, ZDNET has compared the best iPad models currently available.

title: Kindle Scribe vs ReMarkable 2 Tablet
description: Amazon is one of the first giants to release an e-ink writing tablet, but it's not the very first company to feature an e-ink device that you can write on. Here are our first impressions of two top choices, and which one you should choose for taking notes on the go.

title: The 6 best MagSafe battery packs of 2022
description: Portable power banks are so yesterday. If you have an iPhone 12, iPhone 13, or iPhone 14, treat yourself to a MagSafe battery pack. We found six of the best available. These magnetic wireless chargers use Apple's MagSafe tech to smartly top up your iPhone.

title: The 10 best TV deals right now: September 2022
description: Whether you want to host a football watch party with friends or make your home feel like a theater, you can take advantage of steep discounts on a new TV. Brands like LG, Sony, and Samsung have awesome sales, and just in time for fall sports and 2022 TV premieres.

title: The next time you go out, Google Maps will give you the "neighborhood vibe"
description: Google Maps wants to help you understand the "neighborhood vibe" of a place by surfacing locations that generate solid user feedback.

title: Google is making eco-friendly routing on Maps available to developers for free
description: Businesses that use Google Maps to find routes for their drivers -- such as ridesharing companies or delivery companies -- will be able to use eco-routing within their own apps for their own user base, thus saving them money on fuel.

title: Trade in your old devices for Amazon gift cards. Here's how
description: Amazon's Trade-In Program turns your unwanted electronics into Amazon gift cards. It's also a fast and simple way to get discounts on the latest Amazon products.

title: How we search the web is changing, so Google Search is changing too
description: Inspired in part by Gen Z, which is increasingly turning to sources like TikTok and and Reddit for information, Google is revamping its search engine.

title: The best MacBook deals right now: September 2022
description: For whatever reason you need a new MacBook, we've found the best Apple deals on the latest laptops and computers.

title: Amazon's Fire TV lineup adds the Omni QLED and more
description: In addition to a host of new announcements regarding Kindles, Dots, and more, Amazon announced a new lineup of new Fire TV streaming devices and smart TVs. We have all the details here.

title: Amazon unveils 2nd Gen Ring Panic Button for your most pressing matters
description: The new $29 Panic Button has a sleeker, more compact design and customizable features for enhanced emergency services.

title: Amazon unveils 2nd-gen Ring Panic Button for your most pressing matters
description: The new $29 Panic Button has a sleeker, more compact design and customizable features for enhanced emergency services.

title: Microsoft is phasing out SwiftKey for iOS
description: The SwiftKey for iOS predictive keyboard will be delisted from the Apple App Store as of October 5. Microsoft isn't (publicly, at least) saying why.

title: Everything Amazon just announced and how to buy it all
description: Here's a brief recap of everything Amazon just announced, including a new Kindle Scribe, new Ring cameras, and a new Halo device that watches you sleep.

title: Amazon's household robot Astro can now recognize your cats and dogs
description: Amazon's household robot can now check-in on your pet and send you live video even when you are not home.

title: Matter hits close to home: Amazon prepares to add it to most of devices
description: Amazon has announced that all its smart home devices will be compatible with Matter by the end of this year.

title: Amazon's second-gen Echo Auto offers roadside assistance
description: Amazon announced the second-generation Echo Auto for $54.99. It brings new, smarter features including roadside assistance calling.

title: Eero launches new power-over-ethernet devices for home & business
description: The new hardware line brings Eero's mesh Wi-Fi system to small business owners.

title: Here are all the new Amazon Echo devices announced in 2022
description: During its annual hardware event, the e-commerce giant also announced brand new characters of Echo Dot Kids as part of its new Echo lineup.

title: New Echo devices: Every speaker Amazon just announced
description: During its annual hardware event, the e-commerce giant also announced brand new characters of Echo Dot Kids as part of its new Echo lineup.

title: Ring's new Spotlight Cam Pro has motion-tracking radar
description: Amazon's event played home to the debut of a new, compact spotlight cam with radar and a built-in Birds Eye View.

title: Amazon's Halo Rise tracks your sleep without a wristband, camera, or microphone
description: Amazon's new sleep tracking device uses 'no contact' sensors to help you get a better night's sleep.

title: Blink has a new floodlight camera and Blink Mini mount
description: Amazon-owned Blink announces a pair of new products, including the Blink Wired Floodlight Camera -- a first for the company.

title: Amazon's friendly robot helper Astro will now double as a security guard for your business
description: Today, Amazon announced that its Astro robot can now function as a security patrol for your business through an integration with Ring.

title: Soon, your Amazon Echo Dot will serve as an Eero Wi-Fi extender
description: Eero, the Amazon-owned mesh Wi-Fi brand, is bringing its eero Built-in technology to the popular family of Amazon smart speakers.

title: Amazon Kindle Scribe: Here comes the first Kindle you can write and sketch on
description: The Kindle Scribe lets you leave notes on what you read, sketch, and more.

title: Creators: Save 45% on the Samsung EVO Plus SDXC Card
description: Never stop creating with this 256GB flash memory card. Perfect for DSLR and mirrorless cameras, this handy card stores seemingly endless photographs and video footage.

title: Apple: iOS 16's Stage Manager is coming to older iPad Pros
description: Apple will bring Stage Manager to older iPad Pro devices but it's delaying support for second displays.

title: Microsoft takes another step toward launching the new unified Outlook
description: Microsoft's 'Project Monarch' unified Outlook app on Windows is moving forward with a refreshed beta release that's becoming available to more testers.

title: How to lock active incognito tabs on Android Chrome for more privacy
description: Here's how to to lock up your Android Chrome incognito tabs behind your password, fingerprint, and facial recognition to increase your mobile privacy.

title: Oura Ring Gen 3 Horizon: Same features, no more flat spot
description: It's been a year since Oura revealed its Gen 3 Ring and it has rolled out several updates since that release. The new model delivers the same software and data, but is perfectly round with no flat spot.

title: Google's absolute dominance of web traffic, in one simple chart
description: By comparison, Facebook is pretty much just a rounding error.

title: There's been a big rise in hackers targeting Google Chrome - doing this one thing can help protect you
description: We enter and store a lot of information in our internet browsers, making them a tempting target for cyber criminals.

title: Is Microsoft really going to cut off security updates for your 'unsupported' Windows 11 PC?
description: Microsoft's "fear, uncertainty, and doubt" campaigns are normally aimed at competitors. So it's a little odd to see the company discouraging its own customers from installing a Microsoft product.

title: NASA shields Artemis rocket from hurricane, launch now likely in November
description: NASA staff at Kennedy Space Center evacuate over a fire alarm shortly after removing its moon rocket from the launch pad.

title: Intel CEO shows off 'slideable' PC, pronounces Moore's Law not dead
description: Could slideable PCs using Samsung's flexible OLED displays give a boost to PC shipments?

title: Lenovo's new ThinkReality VRX headset is an all-in-one gateway to the enterprise Metaverse
description: The company's new enterprise VR push includes off-the-shelf hardware and a slate of customized services and solutions for enterprise customers seeking an on-ramp to the Metaverse.

title: Hackers are making DDoS attacks sneakier and harder to protect against
description: Simple yet effective, DDoS attacks are a major threat to online services – but they aren't unstoppable.

title: This TaoTronics PC Soundbar is only $10
description: This dual-connectivity soundbar will provide improved audio quality when you are gaming and streaming.

title: How Intel is upgrading everything about itself and its products
description: Chipmaker is making much more than CPUs thanks to new AI/ML applications, plans for new fabs, a revised GPU strategy and plans to become its own wafer foundry.
